title: Do you need to shield yourself or your home from 5G devices installed close to your residence? How? - Quora

response.answer_text: No. 5G will use higher frequencies than cellular, and as frequency goes up, so does loss, or attenuation. Said another way, as the frequency goes up, the less power can get through walls, glass, etc. Radio stations are up to 50,000 watts, and there are dozens of those in a city. Broadcast TV can be 100,000 watts (even higher for stations that were “grandfathered” when rules chnaged. AM radio, the lowest frequencies of all, can be 50,000 watts, and at say AM 1000, the frequency is more than 800 times lower than original cell frequencies, 2000 times lowere than the second batch of cell frequencies, and the power transmitted is a fraction of what AM stations pit out. AM stations work better inside, in the basement,etc because ofvthis, than FM stations, which are around 100 time the frequency of AM, and half the allowed power. You are surrounded by RF. The short millimetre waves that are used in the 5G network ranges from 24GHz up to 300GHz. These waves can not travel well through walls, trees or water. This provides a great shielding benefit for someone trying to protect themselves from the harmful EMF waves. For the 5G network that utilizes the frequencies of up to 6GHz, RF shielding fabric based on Stainless Steel, Copper or Silver threads will provide adequate protection. Make sure that the attenuation of the fabric is more than 25db, and you purchase it from a reliable source.
